reviews.text: Before I have booked this hotel, I have been told by serveral of my Greek friends that in Athens even if you are willing to pay, you may not necessary guarantee good room or service.
reviews.title: Expense you do pay what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Melia Athens has been recommand by more than one friends. They both said the same thing: you will pay for the price but on the other hand there is a baseline guarantee on quality of room and service. I think this is best way to describe my recent expereinced in Melia.
reviews.title: Crappy location, good rooms

reviews.text: Melia Hotel situated in the area call Omonnia, from what I knew and saw, it is not the best location in Athens but not the worst.. We are always very vigilance when we are walking around the hotel area but we also felt safe because of the constant presence of the Athens police petrolling.
reviews.title: Ok for a weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived , the front desk staff (they always polite and with smile throughout our stay) are in hand to check us in. We filled in the forms, within few minutes both us and our lugguges are in our room. When we walked into our room, the first thing I realised is the baby cot already placed in our room (we were travelling with our 8 months old daughter). We have opted to pay a little exta for the room with Jacuzzi. The room is clean, good fair size, well equiped...so far all positive sign
reviews.title: Slightly disappointing

reviews.text: The hotel is about 10 floors or so tall with an excellent roof garden. It manages to fit bar/restaurant/swimming pool all at one place. The staffs at the roof garden are friendly and efficient. The view was turely amazing both during the day and the evening over looking acropolis. We did dine twice at the roof garden during our four nights stay,.The menu is very small and it is on the expensive side. Let say the friendly staff, the beautiful sence make up the not so interesting expensive food.
reviews.title: nice hotel awful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the georgio three nights starting 24/5/08. the hotel is a welcome haven from the hustle and bustle of athens. it is beautfully decorated, the staff are friendly, professional and helpful, and our room spotless, spacious and comfortable. i without hesitation recommend this hotel to all. the bed was large and extremely comfortable, the jacuzzi bath fantastic, the breakfast excellent and the roof top pool a welcome distraction. i find it very difficult indeed to say anything negative about it. athens city was the disappointment ! this city of culture spoilt by thieves, beggars and grafetti "vandals" my highlight was a visit to "mars hill" the very place where paul the apostle preached to the athenians as in acts. 17:22.
reviews.title: oasis in athens

reviews.text: The hotel is in an area which looks really run down, but the hotel itself is really beautiful. You feel like you're in a different world once you step into the hotel.
reviews.title: Love Residence Georgio

likes.liked: — The rooms, Pool area, Pool bar.

reviews.text: The staff were very courteous and helpful, and the rooms were great. Beautifully furnished, great bathroom, and nice comfortable bed! I could have stayed in bed all day .. If only the pool area wasn't so nice!! The pool has views of the Acropolis, and there were more than enough sun beds for everyone to enjoy. Great little bar at the pool for drinks and bar food too. Pool area turns into a wonderful restaurant at night. Great food, and the view of the Acropolis at night is lovely. Breakfast was buffet, with everything you could think of! Room service food was excellent too.
reviews.title: Almost 5 star hotel

reviews.text: It was a 10 min walk to Syntagma Square to go shopping, but there's many shops to see along the way, so location is fine!
reviews.title: Service killed the whole deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Conveniently located between Syntagma and Amonio plazas, this hotel was not quite the 5 stars it promised. First, reception staff was not uniformly nice or knowledgeable. Second, the rooms did not have hair conditioner-- for a 5 star hotel this is de rigeur!
reviews.title: great if you dont want any sleep

reviews.text: checked in with my wife and 16 yr old son for 3 nights through website "booking.com". The triple room was a double room with a rollaway bed; knew this before hand so no snags. However, the extra bed was not suitable for anyone older than about 8 yrs old and should certainly not be classed as a triple room. After 1 night duly complained and discovered they did not have anything to offer us in the way of a suitable single bed. Negotiated an upgrade at half-price for the executive suite which featured a sofa-bed that did pull down into a suitable bed. Once i had complained everything sorted brilliantly by the reception staff and the house keeping manager who were all extremely sympathetic. Well done.
reviews.title: not quite a triple room then!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a short city break and throuroughly enjoyed it! We stayed on the 8th floor in a larger deluxe room and it was superb - clean, roomy and luxurious! I would definately stay there again having stayed in various other Athens hotels!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there 4 consecutive nights in November and this was our 1st time in Athens. Although it is located in the city centre, we found the hotel's location a bit too far from "where it happens". Indeed, it is located on a big avenue and not far from Omonia's metro station, but there is nothing going in the area in the evening (except a Starbucks Coffe and an interesting vegetarian store/cafeteria open till 8 pm). The room was small to my taste, although we booked a Deluxe Double Room (and I precise that we paid its full price). The bathroom was a small, clean and modern usual hotel bathroom and came with whirlpool tub and massage shower in the tub. We used those installations, that were very noisy but OK, but not in brand new condition as I have read in a few other recent comments (there were traces of rust around the metallic parts). The carpet in the room is a "comfort" type of carpet, but I had the feeling that it was not very clean. Surfing on Internet is charged, contrarily to lots of 4 stars hotels in Athens and other major European cities. The staff were OK but nothing particular to say about them since they kind of ignore you... we asked for simple map on our arrival and they did not have any... so they gave us a photocopy that was unreadable.
reviews.title: Not bad, but not the best

likes.disliked: — Too small, a bit to pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a very good on-line rate, which included a room upgrade and breakfast, making it the same price as many 3* hotels.
reviews.title: Loved the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was splendid, very comfortable and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: A little pricey but good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received two free nights here though the travel agency that we booked our cruise through and I don't have any complaints. The room and public areas were all very nice.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — drinks, phone and food were all very expensive

reviews.title: Great Convenient Hotel
reviews.text: There's not much in the area of town where it's located, but as everyone else has stated, it's within a couple blocks from the bus and metro, so you can get anywhere pretty quick.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a nice little bakery just down the street on the way to Omonia square where we got breakfast and coffee each morning and it was pretty cheap.
reviews.title: The best around!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Don't make any calls from the phones.. they charge you an arm and a leg. We made one local call and I think it was around 5 euro.
reviews.title: Everything was Great!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, location, staff, value for money

reviews.text: Just wanted to share our experience at this hotel. The hotel service was great, the breakfast that was included was good and so was the location. It was located near the train station which gave us the ability to take the train to go to the historical sites and even the airport. The hotel itself was modern and the shower/bathroom was very nice. The pool on top was very nice too. You could even see the Acropolis in the distance. We would definitely stay there again. PS: We LOVED Greece!!
reviews.title: Terrible desk manager service
